Header: The Premier urges the general public to safeguard democracy
Content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe emphasises that democracy that was secured by the government should be protected and continued. Prime Minister Wickremesinghe stated that it is the duty of the general public to safeguard democracy. He was speaking at a public rally that was held at the Manippai area in Jaffna. Speaking further the Premier noted that the incumbent government is committed to secure democracy both in the North and the South. The Prime Minister stated that the people in every corner of the island enjoy freedom at present. People from the South visit Nagadeepa and northerners visit Galle. People living in Batticaloa can go to every nook of the country. Prime Minister Wickremesinghe highlighted that former President Ranasinghe Premadasa who happened to be the father of presidential candidate of the New Democratic Front Sajith Premadasa embarked a massive development project in the Northern Province. The Prime Minister recalled that the housing development project that was implemented by Ranasinghe Premadasa was discontinued due to war. He urged the people of the North to cast their vote in favour of Sajith Premadasa to ensure development activities and democracy in the province. He added that by casting vote for symbol swan only white van culture of the country can be uprooted.
